name: Fisherstrand
economy_niches: Seasonal labor supply for long-range fleets
culture_adjustments: Stronger clan control over boat lanes and quotas
Ritualized night-navigation practices more elaborate and frequent
Guild courts override kin-councils in maritime disputes
Higher social tolerance for petty smuggling tied to livelihoods
Women prominent in fish-markets and curing industries
constraints: Guild charters restrict establishment of new burgs
Combustion-derived industry capped by low-pressure steam norms
notes: Seasonal migration to open-ocean fleets shapes labor rhythms
Major supplier of salted provisions for State_13
Local guilds maintain private nav-augury workshops (rituals consume costly reagents)
Harbor maintenance requires recurring communal levies
